title: Introduction to Excel
note: This section introduces Microsoft Excel as a powerful spreadsheet application. It covers the basic interface: the ribbon, worksheets, rows, columns, and cells. The context is the modern desktop version of Excel.

title: Data Entry and Formatting
note: Covers how to enter text, numbers, and dates into cells. The lesson also introduces basic cell formatting, including font styles, alignment, cell borders, and number formats (e.g., Currency, Percentage).

title: Introduction to Formulas and Cell References
note: Introduces formulas using arithmetic operators (`+`, `-`, `*`, `/`). It also explains the critical difference between relative (`A1`), absolute (`$A$1`), and mixed (`A$1` or `$A1`) cell references.

title: Basic Functions: SUM, AVERAGE, COUNT, MAX, MIN
note: Introduces some of the most common built-in functions in Excel: `SUM` for adding numbers, `AVERAGE` for finding the mean, `COUNT` for counting cells with numbers, and `MAX`/`MIN` for finding the largest/smallest value.

title: Managing Worksheets and Workbooks
note: Covers how to manage worksheets (renaming, adding, deleting, moving, copying) and workbook-level features like freezing panes to keep headers visible while scrolling through large datasets.

title: Sorting and Filtering Data
note: Explains how to sort data based on one or more columns and how to use AutoFilter to quickly display only the data that meets specific criteria.

title: Working with Excel Tables
note: Explains the benefits of formatting a data range as an Excel Table. The lesson covers creating tables, using table styles, and how tables automatically expand and provide features like built-in filtering and total rows.

title: Structured References in Tables
note: Demonstrates how to use structured references (e.g., `TableName[ColumnName]`) when working with Excel Tables. This makes formulas more readable and resilient to changes in the table structure.

title: Introduction to Charts
note: This lesson covers how to create basic charts to visualize data. It explains how to select data for a chart and how to create and format common chart types like column, line, and pie charts.

title: Conditional Formatting
note: This lesson covers how to use conditional formatting to automatically change the appearance of cells based on their values. It demonstrates data bars, color scales, icon sets, and rule-based formatting.

title: Logical Functions: IF, AND, OR
note: Introduces the powerful `IF` function for performing a logical test. It also explains how to use the `AND` and `OR` functions, often within an `IF` function, to test multiple logical conditions at once.

title: Lookup Functions: VLOOKUP and XLOOKUP
note: This section explains how to find and retrieve data from a table. It covers the classic `VLOOKUP` function and introduces the modern and more flexible `XLOOKUP` function as the recommended best practice.

title: Text Functions
note: This lesson covers a range of functions for manipulating text, such as `CONCAT` (and the `&` operator), `LEFT`, `RIGHT`, `TRIM`, and `FIND`. It demonstrates how to clean and reformat text data.

title: Date and Time Functions
note: Explains how to work with dates and times in Excel. The lesson covers functions like `TODAY`, `NOW`, `DATE`, `YEAR`, and `DATEDIF` for performing calculations with date and time values.

title: Data Validation
note: Explains how to use data validation to restrict the type of data or the values that users can enter into a cell. The lesson covers creating dropdown lists from a range and setting custom validation rules.

title: Introduction to PivotTables
note: Provides an introduction to PivotTables, one of Excel's most powerful features for summarizing, analyzing, and exploring large datasets. The lesson covers creating a basic PivotTable and arranging fields in the PivotTable Fields pane.

title: Analyzing Data with PivotTables
note: Dives deeper into PivotTables by explaining how to sort, filter, and group data. The lesson also covers changing the summary calculation (e.g., from SUM to AVERAGE) and showing values as a percentage of the total.

title: Slicers, Timelines, and PivotCharts
note: Introduces slicers and timelines as interactive controls for filtering PivotTables. It also explains how to create a PivotChart, which is a chart that is linked to a PivotTable, to create dynamic dashboards.

title: What-If Analysis: Goal Seek and Scenarios
note: Introduces Excel's What-If Analysis tools. This lesson covers Goal Seek for finding the required input for a desired result, and Scenario Manager for comparing the outcomes of different sets of assumptions.

title: Advanced What-If: The Solver Add-in
note: This lesson introduces the Solver Add-in as a more powerful optimization tool. It explains how Solver can be used to find an optimal value for a formula by changing multiple input cells, subject to a set of constraints.

title: Dynamic Array Formulas
note: A dedicated lesson on the modern dynamic array engine in Microsoft 365. It explains how formulas can now 'spill' results into multiple cells and introduces key functions like `FILTER`, `SORT`, `UNIQUE`, and `SEQUENCE`.

title: Introduction to Power Query
note: Provides an introduction to Power Query (Get & Transform Data) for importing, connecting, and transforming data from various sources. The lesson shows how to perform basic cleaning and shaping operations before loading data into Excel.

title: The Data Model and Power Pivot
note: This lesson explains how to go beyond single-table analysis by using Excel's Data Model. It introduces Power Pivot as the tool to create relationships between multiple tables, forming a relational model directly within Excel.

title: Introduction to DAX
note: This lesson introduces DAX as the formula language for Power Pivot. It explains the difference between a calculated column and a measure (a key DAX concept) and demonstrates a few simple DAX formulas like `SUMX` and `CALCULATE`.

title: Introduction to Macros and VBA
note: This lesson introduces macros for automating repetitive tasks in Excel. It covers how to use the Macro Recorder to create a simple macro and provides a brief introduction to the Visual Basic for Applications (VBA) editor.
